name: ytdl-sub
description: ytdl-sub is a self-hosted, automation-focused wrapper for yt-dlp that subscribes to channels and playlists, periodically downloading new content according to defined rules.
features: Subscription automation: Define channels and playlists to monitor and download new content automatically on a schedule.
Rule-based filtering: Set criteria for which videos to download based on title, duration, upload date, or metadata.
Preset configurations: Use pre-built presets for common scenarios like music videos, podcasts, or educational content.
Media server formatting: Organize downloads with naming conventions and folder structures compatible with Plex and Jellyfin.
Incremental downloads: Only fetch new videos since the last run to minimize bandwidth and processing time.
NFO file generation: Create metadata files for media servers with episode numbers, descriptions, and artwork.
Thumbnail management: Download and organize video thumbnails as poster images for media library displays.
Subtitle handling: Automatically download and embed subtitles in preferred languages with fallback options.
Quality presets: Configure default quality settings per subscription to balance file size and video quality.
Dry run mode: Preview what would be downloaded without actually fetching files to test configurations.
YAML configuration: Define all subscriptions and rules in human-readable YAML files for version control.
Notification hooks: Trigger webhooks or scripts when new content is downloaded for integration with other systems.
